snippet: The soft drink company’s revenue fell short of analysts’ expectations.
abstract: Coca-Cola reports third-quarter revenue that fell short of Wall Street's expectations, pulled down by declines in Europe and Asia; reports third-quarter net income of  $2.31 billion, or 50 cents a share, up from $2.22 billion, or 48 cents a share, one year earlier; revenue rose 1 percent to $12.34 billion, with analysts expecting $12.41 billion.
lead_paragraph: The soft drink company’s revenue fell short of analysts’ expectations.

headline.seo: Coca-Cola Earnings Dented by a Strong Dollar
